brand.name: Probador Colectiva
brand.story:
Çağatay Gülabioğlu opened Kronotrop in 2012 as Turkey's first specialty coffee shop, then left in 2014 to build something more focused. A four-storey Beyoğlu building houses Giesen W15 and W1 roasters, an SCA-certified lab, and training rooms where Q Grader exams run. He won the SCA Turkey Roasting Championship three years running, 2015 to 2017.

The tasting room serves V60 and Kalita Wave filter, straight espresso on a La Marzocco GS3, and specialty teas from Berlin's Companion Tea. No milk drinks, no takeaway. Polished concrete floors and exposed ductwork run through the double-height space, with a light blue subway tile counter.
brand.description: Probador Colectiva uluslararası normlarda kahve eğitimi ve kahve üretimine odaklanmış bir projedir.  Q Grader ve SCA akreditasyonlu ekibimizle haftalık taze kavrum, kahve aboneliği, cupping ve eğitim. Online sipariş, mağazadan teslim
brand.ownRoastDesc: Omni-roast philosophy treating each coffee according to its own taste profile. Sources from specialty importers with direct trade models.

brand.name: Norm Coffee
brand.story:
Cem Bozkuş pulls minimum one-minute extractions facing the Bosphorus from the corner of Cihangir Park. He previously worked at Petra Roasting and the farm-to-table restaurant Kantin. A rotating multi-roaster selection includes beans from Probador Collectiva, roasted by Çağatay Gülabioğlu, Turkey's first Q grader. Partner Gizem Yavuz runs the daily-changing pastry menu.

White walls, polished grey concrete floors, and light wood benches fill the room. Large black-framed windows face Güneşli Sokak. Dogs welcome.

brand.name: Cottontree Coffee Roasters
brand.story:
Ton handles the roasting; partner Fai runs the bakery. Their Thai names translate to Tree and Cotton, hence the brand. They've roasted since 2015, focusing on Thai single-estate lots from Pang Khon, Doi Chang, and Mae Jantai on a 2-kilogram Has Garanti, with seasonal Ethiopian and Kenyan beans joining the lineup.

A turquoise mint grinder and La Marzocco anchor the dark wood counter. Colourful cups in turquoise, yellow, and red sit below white pendant lights. V60, Chemex, and syphon round out the brew options. Cash only.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Award-winning roastery with visible 2kg Has Garanti roaster. Creates signature Cottontree blend (Thai, Indonesian, Brazilian beans) and single-origin offerings. Third wave focus on lighter roasts.

brand.name: Roastniyom Coffee
brand.story:
Five locations span Chiang Mai, from Nimman's Siri Mangkalajarn Road to Jing Jai Market and the university district. The flagship is built around a full-size tree growing through the middle of the shop.

Beans come from Set Coffee Roaster and include Huay Hom single origin. The signature Thai-style iced coffee has a sweet, latte-like body. Inside, grey-blue exposed brick lines the seating area alongside black tufted leather banquettes and light wood tables. Sugarcane straws replace plastic.

brand.name: Roots
brand.story:
Chatchalerm Lertanekwattana won the 2025 World Cup Tasters title in Geneva, Thailand's first victory at any World Coffee Championship. Founder Varatt Vichit-Vadakan, the 2014 Thailand Barista Champion, launched Roots in 2013 with head roaster Korn Sanguenkeaw and experience specialist Somdej Luengtaviboon.

The roastery works exclusively with Thai beans from eight farming families across Chiang Rai, Chiang Mai, Tak, and Mae Hong Son. A cup-to-farm programme returns revenue to origin communities. Single origins include Sanchai, Pangkhon Village, Aten from Mae Daet Noi, and Chang Pao from Le Tor Glo. The House Blend combines 65% Pangkhon Black Honey with Mae Suay and Kenya-washed Pangkhon lots.

Roasting philosophy: sweet, balanced profiles preserving origin characteristics. Produces single-origins (Sanchai and Pangkhon Village) and blends (Aftersweet Blend and Classic Kids Blend).

brand.name: Terroir.BKK SONGWAT
brand.story:
Park Tosatep Tanpraphat earned the alias 'Brew Boy' working Australian farms before studying fermentation for five years under Jake Hu, a Taiwanese world-level competition judge. He opened Everyday CNX in Chiang Mai to work directly with Northern Thai growers, then found this renovated shophouse at 1218 Songwat Road by chance.

A speedbar runs espresso through the centre while a slow bar by the window handles filter. The 'Everyday' line sits alongside competition lots including Panama Esmeralda Geisha and Colombia El Vergel. Bare concrete walls, metal stools, graffiti-stained windows. One of Songwat's most popular stops.
brand.description: A stand-out specialty coffee roastery on the historic Song Wat Road, known for its raw, industrial-loft aesthetic and 'dark' cool tones. The shop focuses intensely on the 'terroir' of coffee beans, serving high-quality single origins and house blends in a renovated shophouse setting.

brand.name: Khagee Cafe
brand.story:
Thames and Miki, a Thai-Japanese couple, styled Khagee after Japanese zakka cafes. The name means green in Thai. Thames works the La Marzocco Strada bar, pulling shots from a seasonal Samadool Coffee espresso blend with caramel and chocolate notes.

Miki bakes everything with natural yeast: baguettes, bagels, scones, and signature melon pan alongside green tea canelé. Popular items sell out before 3 PM. White brick walls, a wooden counter, concrete floors, and a Japanese magazine reading section fill the interior near Nawarat Bridge.

brand.name: Nine One Coffee
brand.story:
Wullop Pasananon, known as Mr. One, left a Bangkok desk job to teach himself organic coffee farming at Doi Saket. He now directs the Specialty Coffee Association of Thailand. His 9-1 Organic Coffee Farm sits at 1,450 to 1,550 metres in Mae Ton Luang, where heavy shade encourages stronger flavours. A stream-powered wet mill processes washed and natural lots, including a blueberry-noted micro-lot and the 'Fruity Flora' natural.

An orange accent wall and yellow wood paneling frame three grinders at the Nimman shop. The farm itself hosts a cafe, a roasting workshop, and a four-cabin resort. Four branches run between Chiang Mai and Chiang Rai.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Nine One Coffee operates a complete organic farm-to-cup operation. They grow Arabica at 1,450-1,550m elevation on their Doi Saket farm, process the cherries on-site, and roast all beans themselves. The forest-grown method under natural shade develops characteristic sweetness.

brand.name: Roast8ry
brand.story:
Arnon Thitiprasert won the 2017 World Latte Art Championship in Budapest after three consecutive Thailand national titles. Originally from Trang, he spent six years making coffee in Sydney before opening Roast8ry around 2020, following his split from Ristr8to. The number eight is his obsession, noting that Arabica coffee carries 44 chromosomes.

A 6kg Giesen roaster supplies both Nimman locations. The La Marzocco GB5 handles espresso, while a brew bar runs V60, Chemex, Aeropress, Syphon, Clever Dripper, and Woodneck alongside an EK-43 grinder.

brand.name: Alchemy
brand.story:
Anne and Joe O'Hara left corporate careers after a 2000 backpacking trip through Central America. They started serving at Henley Regatta, then Glastonbury from 2005, clocking over 4,000 events across 16 years.

In 2008 they established the Wimbledon roastery. Brynhildr, an 85-year-old reconditioned roaster, handles light profiles from 70% Direct Trade beans. Fifth-generation Brazilian producer Homero Paiva in Santo Antônio do Amparo supplies the Opus espresso. Three cafes now run across the City, Shoreditch, and Spitalfields.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Light roasts on 85-year-old reconditioned roaster named Brynhildr in Wimbledon. 70% Direct Trade sourced, including fifth-generation Brazilian farm in Santo Antônio do Amparo. Blends: Opus (75% Brazil/25% Colombia) and Elixir (75% Rwanda/25% Brazil).

brand.name: Formative Coffee
brand.story:
The title came in a blind knockout: national champions brew five espressos each, judged without knowing who made them. Kissick also won the 2023 UK Barista Championship and placed sixth at the 2024 Worlds in Busan. Head roaster Nicholas Pastellopoulos is a Q grader and SCA Authorized Trainer, and barista Haruka Nango won the 2024 UK Latte Art Championship.

From Magherafelt in Northern Ireland, Kissick discovered specialty coffee at Workshop in Fitzrovia before opening on Butler Place in March 2019. Projects Office designed the 80-square-metre flatiron corner: a curved black bar echoes the building's shape, bespoke terrazzo counters sit on black terrazzo floors, and an orange ceiling is the sole colour accent.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Nicholas Pastellopoulos serves as head roaster and Q Arabica grader, handling green buying and roast development. The program categorizes coffees as Benchmark, Exceptional, Competition, Future, or Decaf. Guest roasters including La Cabra feature alongside house roasts.

brand.name: Flat White
brand.story:
Cameron McClure, Peter Hall, and James Gurnsey opened on Berwick Street in September 2005, the first Antipodean-style specialty coffee shop in London. For six months, hardly anyone came. Then word spread and they were pulling 700 flat whites daily from Europe's first four-group Synesso.

James Hoffmann was a regular. Peter Dore-Smith studied the baristas here before opening Kaffeine in 2009. Starbucks added flat whites to their UK menu in 2010 after watching the demand this shop created. The cafe started with Monmouth beans, switched to Square Mile around 2008, and now runs Dark Arts Coffee.

brand.name: Bowler Coffee Roasters
brand.story:
Mathijs Antoon Olij, an Indonesian of Dutch descent, founded the roastery in 2016. The Probat Type-3 arrived from Germany, and a Faema E61 pulls espresso from rotating lots including Colombian De Los Andes and Ethiopian Illubabor.

Corrugated metal walls and orange-framed bowler hat artwork line the bazaar stall. Fresh stroopwafels and Dutch pastries fill the counter. Olij hosts live music nights and displays work by local Almaty artists.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Customised 1958 Emmericher Maschinenfabrik Type-3 Probat drum roaster. Espresso on Faema E61.

brand.name: WatchHouse
brand.story:
Roland Horne traded his luxury aquarium consultancy for coffee, opening the first inside an octagonal 1810 guard house on Bermondsey Street in 2014. They took the Independent title at the 2023 European Coffee Symposium in Barcelona, then the Chain award a year later. Locations now reach London, Bath, the Chrysler Building in New York, and Abu Dhabi.

A refurbished 1959 Probat UG22 from Bonanza in Berlin anchors the Maltby Street roastery. Head roaster Nikol Novotna, a Q Arabica Grader and SCA Sensory Judge, sources from Ethiopia's Bensa highlands, China's Dongka farm in Yunnan, and Brazil's Mio Fazenda. Deidra Hodgson, formerly of Aesop, leads the interiors programme.
brand.description: Cosy, unique coffee spots & eateries in London. We make great coffee and exceptional food within beautifully bespoke environments tailored around our local community. It is as simple as that. | Never worry about running out of coffee supplies again. The Modern Coffee experience from the comfort of your own home.
brand.ownRoastDesc: Specialty coffee roaster with dedicated Coffee Labs in South London and New York. Offers three coffee lines: Rituals (everyday), Ventures (adventurous), and Horizons (expressive/unusual). Sources globally with focus on provenance and quality.

brand.name: Knockbox Coffee
brand.story:
Founder Mete designed the furniture for this postage stamp-sized room at the junction with Dombey Street. Exposed timber beams, Edison bulb pendants, and trailing plants fill the interior. An orange terracotta wall backs the glass pastry display. A two-group La Marzocco Linea pulls Workshop's seasonal single-origin espresso.

Outdoor picnic tables suit the English village feel of this central London corner. Weekend brunch and handmade toasties alongside a signature chai latte.
